resources.string: Would you like to exit the application?
It seems you have made an empty choice. Please contact the developer for more help.
Road Traffic Signs and Rules of the Road
Learn road traffic signs and rules of the road title
Take a short random quiz to test yourself. There is no scoring, and you can take it as often as you want. \n\nSelect categories on which to be tested on.
Test cards guide or information signs title
Test cards rule of the road title
You cannot navigate back from the test!
You cannot navigate back, click done to return to the main menu.
Please select a topic to get tested on.
You cannot navigate back from the test!

This is a longer test of your knowledge of the road traffic signs and markings, as well as the rules of the road. There are 30 questions in total, so give yourself ample time to answer them all. They have been selected randomly from every topic to ensure that every part is tested. These are mulitple choice questions. \n\nThere is scoring, so try your best!
Cannot submit a response until you select a value.
You scored x in the test/exam.
Test complete button or navigate to main menu button
Would you like to save your settings before exiting this screen?
What is the first rule of the road?
Drive on the left hand side, pass the right hand side.
What is the permitted speed of travel on the road?
It is dependent on the area and section of the road that I am driving on.
What are you supposed to do when people and animals cross the road infront of you?
You are supposed to check your mirrors for traffic, stop, give the people or animal a chance to pass, and then continue driving.
In which areas are you supposed to drive with caution?

i. Mist 
ii. Heavy Rain 
iii. Slippery road (e.g. heavy rain, oil spills, etc) 
iv. Dust clouds 
v. At Night
What are you supposed to do when preparing to overtake?

i. Check the mirrors and look ahead for traffic and obstructions 
ii. Confirm or be sure that the rules of the road permit me to overtake 
iii. Check the mirrors again for traffic and obstructions to make certain that the way is clear for me to overtake 
iv. Make a signal that you will be overtaking on the right (use hand signals or use the right indicator), then over take 
v. Check your mirros for traffic and obstructions,make a signal that you intend to return to your lane (left indicator or use a hand signal), if the way is clear, return to your lane
Name seven (7) places where you are not supposed to overtake?

i. Cross-road 
ii. Blind rise 
iii. One vehicle bridge 
iv. Zebra or pedestrian crossing 
v. Robots 
vi. Sharp corners 
vii. T-junction
On which side of the road are you permitted to overtake?
When are you permitted to overtake on the left hand side?
i. When the driver infront or ahead of you indicates that they are making a right hand turn on a one way \nii. When directed or requested by a traffic officer or a road workman
How can you coordinate with other drivers on the road?
Make early indications of what you intend to do.
What must always be in working condition in your car?

i. Tyres 
ii. Windscreen 
iii. Wipers 
iv. Steering 
v. Hooter 
vi. Indicators 
vii. Lights 
viii. Breaks 
ix. Mirrors 
x. Seat belts
How do you approach on coming traffic at night?
Dim the lights (even if the other driver does not), reduce your speed and drive with caution.
What do you do when you have a load that exceeds the dimensions of you car?
i. At night, hang a red triangle at the back \nii. During the day, you may hang a triangle or use a red cloth at the back
Can you over take over a barrier line?
Can you park on a yellow line?
Name five (5) places that you must turn on headlights during the day?

i. Heavy rain 
ii. Dust clouds 
iii. Tunnel 
iv. Mist 
v. Smoke
How do you distinguish a blind man on the road?
i. They carry a white stick, \nii. Or, they are led by another person, \niii. Or, they are led by a trained dog.
What is the weight of a light vehicle or a heavy vehicle?
A light vehicle is 3.5 tonnes and a heavy vehicle (e.g. lorry) is 7 tonnes in weight.
How do you distinguish a heavy vehicle when it cuts across your path, at night?
It has yellow reflectors on the side.
How do you distinguish a heavy vehicle when it is in the on coming traffic, at night?
It has green lights at the top.
What are you supposed to do when approaching a cross road, at night?
Dim the lights and then bright to alert oncoming traffic, then reduce your speed
What is the difference between a light and a heavy vehicle?

i. A heavy vehicle drives slowly, especially on inclined roadways; the driver of a heavy vehicle has to drive to the side and give way to light vehicles. Whereas, a light vehicle drives faster on the road. 
ii. A heavy vehicle has yellow reflectors on the sides, whereas a light vehicle does not. 
iii. A heavy vehicle has green lights infront, at the top. Whereas a light vehicle does not but it may have white reflectors in front. 
iv. A heavy vehicle has a different weight (above 1,800kg) than a light vehicle 
v. A heavy vehicle has chevron belts at the back. Whereas a light vehicle can have red and yellow stripes (of which the red stripes must be reflective, or red retro-reflectors) fixed to the rear-end.
What are you supposed to do if the vehicle you are driving in experiences break failure?
i. Use the hooter to alert other drivers on the road, \nii. Turn the headlights on and off before you lose control of the vehicle, \niii. Use the centre or dividing barrier to slow it down
Where are you not supposed to use a hooter?

i. Royal residence(s) 
ii. School(s) 
iii. Hospital(s) 
iv. Zebra crossing(s) 
v. Robots or Traffic lights 
vi. Pedestrian crossing(s)
What cars are to be given right of way or moved aside for on the road?

i. Ambulance(s) – when they are using the siren 
ii. Police vehicles – when they are using the siren 
iii. National Defense vehicles – when they are using the siren 
iv. Fire and Emergency Trucks – when they are using the siren
Which signs should you see when approaching a one car structure or bridge?

i. Do not overtake 
ii. The road narrows both sides 
iii. Only one car at a time, on the bridge or one vehicle width structure 
iv. Yield sign 
v. Danger plates, on the bridge
Which signs should you see when approaching the end of a freeway?
i. End of the free way or de-restriction – freeway \nii. The road narrows both sides \niii. Two way traffic
State four (4) rules of the road.

i. Drive on the left hand side, pass the right hand side 
ii. Do not drive on the right of the road, you can cause an accident 
iii. Do not drive on the right hand side of the road if the rules prohibit you from doing so 
iv. You may drive on the right if instructed by a traffic officer or road workman
What are you supposed to do if you run over a person and they do not die on the road?

i. Stop the car and administer first aid to the pedestrian or victim (e.g. cyclist) 
ii. Then, track back to where you first bumped the person and where they fell. Make a mark on the road (straight white line) or directly adjacent to the area and off the road, knot some grass 
iii. Then, call for an ambulance or take the person to the emergency room, 
iv. Finally, make sure to report the incident to the police within 24 hours (otherwise you are liable for a road traffic crime)
When should you carry your license?
When should you show your license?
When requested by a confirmed traffic officer or an officer in whom you have an assurance of their duty or responsibility.
When should you turn your headlights on, at sun-down?
Turn the headlights on 30 minutes after sunset.
When should you turn your headlights off, at sun-up?
Turn the headlights off 30 minutes after sunrise.
The headlights are turned on when your visibility on the road has been limited to what distance?
The headlights are turned on when you cannot see 150m ahead on the road.
How much can extra load exceed the dimensions of the car?

i. Load cannot exceed 1.8m behind 
ii. Load cannot exceed 30cm infront 
iii. Load cannot exceed 15cm on the sides 
iv. Or load cannot exceed 2.5m
How do the reflectors on a light vehicle differ?
i. Red reflectors at the back \nii. White reflectors in front
How do the reflectors on a heavy vehicle differ?
i. Yellow reflectors on the side \nii. Red reflectors at the back \niii. White reflectors in front
What is the maximum speed limit in a town or city?
At what speed should one drive in a town or city?
At the speed that is permitted by the traffic regulations in the area that I am driving in.
How do the road traffic signs and markings differ?

i. Regulatory signs 
ii. Warning signs 
iii. Guide or information signs 
iv. Road markings and Road Signals
How many corners on a stop sign?
What is the maximum speed limit permitted in the Kingdom of Eswatini?
What should always be checked in the car hood?

i. Engine oil 
ii. Brake fluid 
iii. Water 
iv. Fan belt 
v. Battery terminals
What is not permitted on the free way?

i. Animals 
ii. Animal drawn carriages 
iii. Pedestrians 
iv. Tractors 
v. Cyclists 
vi. Motorcycles below 50cc (50 cubic cm) 
vii. Hand signal sign 
viii. Driving slowly
What should one use to pull a broken down vehicle?

i. If the vehicle has break failure, you may use a 3.5m iron rod, \nii. If the breaks work, you may use a 1.8m rope or a chain – so that traffic following does not plan to overtake one vehicle at a time
State four (4) differences between a free way and a one way?

One-Way			Free-way 
i. Two lanes	vs	Three or more lanes 
ii. In town/city	vs	Connecting towns 
iii. There are obstructions	vs	There are no obstructions 
iv. Vehicles move according to traffic	vs	Vehicles move at the maximum speed to the traffic
What must always be in the boot of a car?

i. Car jack 
ii. Red triangle 
iii. Spare wheel 
iv. Wheel spanner 
V. Chain 
vi. Tool box
When is the law lenient if you run over a pedestrian (or cyclist) and they die?
If there are more people in the car and the driver could not avoid the pedestrian
State seven (7) places where one can find a barrier line?

i. One vehicle bridge 
ii. Blind rise 
iii. Sharp corners 
iv. Painted island 
v. T-junction 
vi. Zebra crossing 
vii. Cross road
How far on the road do the brightened headlamps shine?
How far on the road do the dimmed headlamps shine?
How do you know you are about to enter a town?
A sign that says “Welcome To {the city name}”
How do you know you are about to leave a town?
Which body parts must be well in order to drive?

i. Eyes 
ii. Ears 
iii. Hands 
iv. Feet 
v. Mind
How far does a car hooter sound on the road?
What is the maximum speed that one should drive when towing another vehicle?
Name five (5) things that can be operated by the driver apart from the steering wheel while driving?

i. Hooter 
ii. Indicators 
iii. Headlamps 
iv. Hazard switch 
v. Wipers
Road reflectors are an enhancement to road markings/lines where there are no street lamps. They are also referred to as cat’s eyes, delineators, road studs, or road turtles.

There are three (3) types of road reflects: 
i. Red; on the barrier line 
ii. White; on the center line 
iii. Yellow; on the yellow line
It is something that can disrupt your driving on the road
There are two (2) types of hazards: \ni. Moving hazards (e.g. people, animals, etc) \nii. Stationary hazards (e.g. potholes, rocks, trees, cans, etc)
How can you tell that an oncoming bus is at full capacity?
It has a board in the front that reads “full/vol”
What are the codes for light and heavy vehicles?
i. Light vehicles are code 8 \nii. Heavy vehicles are code 10
How do you tow a car that has been in an accident, and the front has been damaged?
Use a breakdown, so it may lift the car.
How close may you follow another car, when driving cautiously?
Three segments of the centre line.
How do you turn into a one-way?

When you\'re turning into a one-way street: \ni. Turn into the lane closest to you, unless there are lane markings guiding you to a different lane. \nii. When turning, be careful of other drivers opposite you who are also turning.
Three Periods – No Parking or Stopping
Overhead Lane Direction, Control Signal: closed lane
Overhead Lane Direction, Control Signal: open lane
Road narrows from one side only (reversible)
Motor gate in middle of roadway
Level crossing – two or more tracks
Ride safe pick up point for national servicemen
Free way off ramp ahead: 300m ahead, 200m ahead, 100m ahead (respectively)
Major provincial or territorial route marker
Route to the right and straight on
Route to the left and right
Route to the left and then straight on
Map type – four legged staggered intersection
Overhead direction: informs of a road that branches to the left, heading towards Botha Avenue
Overhead direction: informs of a lane heading towards Strydom Rd.
Overhead direction: informs of two (2) lanes heading towards Germiston
Overhead direction: informs of one (1) lane heading towards Germiston
Overhead direction: informs of lanes heading towards Germiston
Confirmation of the distance left until the stated destination is reached
Combined multiple sharp curve chevron left and right
Lane reduction ahead from left and right
Barrier lines, two (2), with center line between
Barrier line with a center line on the side
Turn left only – straight or right turn prohibited
Proceed straight only – left or right turn prohibited
Turn right only – straight or left turn prohibited
Proceed straight or turn right only – left turn prohibited
Proceed straight or turn left only – right turn prohibited
Bus lane on the right of the other lanes
Bus lane on the left of the other lanes
Bus lane in the center of the other lanes
Exclusive parking bay – SA defence force vehicles
Robot with Alternative Positions for Arrow Lenses
